article.title: Understanding Multiple System Atrophy
article.content: Multiple System Atrophy (MSA) symptoms vary widely depending on which parts of the nervous system are affected. The symptoms typically fall into two categories:
points: Parkinsonian Symptoms: These include tremors, muscle stiffness, slow movements, and difficulty with balance and coordination. This form is often referred to as MSA-P.

Autonomic Symptoms: These involve dysfunction in the autonomic nervous system. Symptoms might include fainting spells, urinary incontinence, and constipation. This form is often referred to as MSA-C (cerebellar type).

reviews.comment: Excellent resource, provided useful tips on identifying symptoms.
This material was very informative and easy to understand.
